subject: Business
title: Platform vs. Product Businesses
description: A quick win: understand Platform vs. Product Businesses.

hook.text: Apple doesn't write most iPhone apps. It built a platform and let millions of developers do it.

buildup.text: A product business sells what it makes. A platform lets others build and sell on top of it.

discovery.text: Platforms scale exponentially because each new participant adds value without extra platform effort.

twist.text: Platforms must solve a cold start problem: no developers without users, no users without apps.

climax.text: Amazon went from selling books to hosting everyone's apps on AWS. Product to platform.

punchline.text: Products make things. Platforms make ecosystems.

quiz.question: What is the cold start problem for platforms?
options: Needing users and developers simultaneously before either exists
The high cost of initial server infrastructure
